page.title: 12First Impressions
page.content: "My first impressions of the school buildings was not very favourable. The paint was peeling,wood was rotting and parts of the roof needed repairing.The newspaper store looked very untidy. The uniform was a bit of a shock because we didn't have one in the schools in which I have previously taught.Later though I realised how much more presentable a uniform looked. I was very impressed in the way the children made me welcome.They were very polite and their work is of a very high standard. I have tried to make the school a lot brighter and cleaner and the lessons will be changed.There will be more science,C.D.T. and much more use of the computers. It was not hard to settle down but I still found it different and strange."
